content.question:
A real estate agent indicates that the mean selling price of all single-family homes in Washington, D.C., is <math alttext="$800,000" overflow="scroll"><mo>$</mo><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math>. A family believes the mean selling price for all single-family homes that are currently for sale is less than the amount indicated by the real estate agent and will select a random sample of single-family homes that are currently for sale in Washington, D.C. Let <math alttext="mu" overflow="scroll"><mi>μ</mi></math> represent the mean selling price, in dollars, of all single-family homes that are currently for sale in Washington, D.C.
Assuming that the conditions for inference are met, which of the following hypotheses would be appropriate to test the family’s belief?

choices.label: <math alttext="H sub 0, colon, mu equals 800,000" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math> versus <math alttext="H sub a, colon, mu is greater than 800,000" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>></mo><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0, colon, mu equals 800,000" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math> versus <math alttext="H sub a, colon, mu is greater than 800,000" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0, colon, mu is less than 800,000" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math> versus <math alttext="H sub a, colon, mu equals 800,000" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0, colon, x bar equals 800,000" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mi>x</mi><mo>¯</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math> versus <math alttext="H sub a, colon, x bar is greater than 800,000" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mi>x</mi><mo>¯</mo></mover><mo>></mo><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0, colon, x bar equals 800,000" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mi>x</mi><mo>¯</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math> versus <math alttext="H sub a, colon, x bar is less than 800,000" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mi>x</mi><mo>¯</mo></mover><mo><</mo><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="H sub 0, colon, mu equals 800,000" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math> versus <math alttext="H sub a, colon, mu is greater than 800,000" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>800</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></math>

topic.text: 7.4: Setting Up a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Identify null and alternative hypotheses.
